Costmap Edit & Download (2D)¶

Below is the costmap details page. The YAML detail will be shown on the left sidebar:

Edit Marks / Paths / Blocks¶

We could add mark points/paths/blocks using the simple UI. After adding them, we could get them as metadata when downloading the map.

  • Zoom in / Zoom out / Zoom reset buttons allow you to see details on the map.

  • When mouse moves in the map area, the coords in real-world coordinate system will show on the top-right of the map

  • We could also click on the map, the coords of clicked point will be shown in popup on the bottom-right

  • Show / hide axis via . The red is x axis; the green is y axis.

Marks¶

  • Add new mark point

    • Click button.

    • Find your mark point position on the map when moving the mouse.

    • Left click the position and hold & drag to the expected direction. Then release the mouse.

    • New mark point with its angle will be added on the map.

  • Edit mark points

    • Click Marks on the left sidebar to show all the marks.

    • Click to highline the mark on the right map.

    • Update the map name on input field. The new name will be updated directly.

    • Click to remove the mark.

Paths¶

  • Add new path

    • Click button.

    • Find your positions of path on the map when moving the mouse.

    • Left click the position to add path points one by one.

    • Click to add the new path into the paths. (The will enable after adding two points for the path)

    • Or click to remove the new drawing path.

  • Edit paths

    • Click Paths on the left sidebar to show all the paths.

    • Click to highline the path on the right map.

    • Update the map name on input field. The new name will be updated directly.

    • Click to remove the path.

Blocks¶

  • Add new block

    • Click button.

    • Find your corner positions of block on the map when moving the mouse.

    • Left click the position to add block corners one by one.

    • Click to add the new block into the blocks. (The will enable after adding one corner for the block)

    • Or click to remove the new block drawing.

  • Edit blocks

    • Click Blocks on the left sidebar to show all the blocks.

    • Click to highline the block on the right map.

    • Update the map name on input field. The new name will be updated directly.

    • Click to remove the block.

Edit Map Image¶

Edit the image directly on the map image. You don’t need to open GIMP again.

Currently, it’s under developing. Coming soon…

Download Map¶

Download via site¶

  • Click on the right side of map details page

  • Save map.zip to your PC. The map.zip includes:

    • map.png, the costmap

    • map.yaml, the related YAML file of the costmap

    • metadata.yaml, the file contains mark points / paths / blocks

API Fetch Map¶

  1. Use our SDK (recommended). For more options or details, please check SDK page.

    • Click Profile & Token link under and land to Profile & Token page.

    • Click button and get the token.

    • Install our sdk.

      pip install git+https://github.com/motivedge/python_sdk.git

    • Find the target map’s MAP_ID in the map details page.

    • Use download.py script which is in our sdk scripts folder to fetch map

      python scripts/download.py -m <map_id> -p <target_folder> --me_token <token>

  2. Use curl and unzip fetch map.

    • Download map via our API (bash code)

      curl -v -o map.zip -X GET "http://api.motivedge.io/map/MAP_ID/2d?me_token=TOKEN"

    • MAP_ID could be found in the map details page. (Next to the map name)

    • me_token is the generated token using above button. (Required field)

    • The fetched map zip file includes map.yaml, map.png (costmap), and metadata.yaml (the marks points / paths / blocks). We could unzip the file (bash code):

      unzip map.zip

Downloaded metadata.yaml Data Struct¶

After downloading above map zip file, it contains metadata.yaml file which contains all the mark points/paths/blocks which we edited on portal site.

When reading yaml file in programs, its data structure likes below:

{
    "marks": [ {
        "name": "docking", # mark point's name
        "x": 1.2, # x coord
        "y": 3.5, # y coord
        "rz": 3.14 # point angle to the x axis
    }, {
        "name": "table201", # mark point's name
        "x": 12.4, # x coord
        "y": 22.5, # y coord
        "rz": 1.5 # point angle to the x axis
    },
    ...], # "marks" contains a list of mark points info

    "paths": [{
        "name": "path2room1", # path's name
        "path": [
            # Contains the ordered list of path points. (x coord, y coord)
            (-1.5, 0.8), # Start point
            (-1.7, 0.5), # middle point
            (-2.3, 1.5), # middle point
            (-5.2, 2.0) # End point
        ]
    },
    ...], # "paths" contains a list of paths info

    "blocks": [{
        "name": "dangerzone", # block area's name
        "corners": [
            # Contains the list of block corner points. (x coord, y coord)
            (1.5, 2.8),
            (1.7, 2.5),
            (2.3, 3.5),
            (5.2, 4.0)
        ]
    },
    ...], # "blocks" contains a list of blocks info
}
